Based upon experience (i.e. Supervisor NEAT). And also, yes, it is 
profoun=
dly more effective to start with your best "knowledge" to 
date, whether su=
pervisor params or experiment results. This also 
facilitates restarts rath=
er than starting from scratch.

Your prediction that some bad parameters wi=
ll be evolved is true, but 
does not disprove the premise that some good pa=
rameters will also be 
evolved. That is what the underlying NEAT concepts a=
re adept at 
dealing with.

Your suggested good experiment has already been=
 performed many times 
over. It required the ability for supervisor NEAT to=
 drive experiment 
NEAT, which as previously stated increases computational=
 
requirements. This is why the need for exploitation of infant 
population=
s to overcome what I call lateral genetic mobility 
limitations. This coupl=
ed with the pyramid population vs. starting 
genome complexity scheme has b=
een utilized. Put the computational 
bullets where they do the most good.

=
